required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-term Safety, Tolerability and Efficacy of Aclidinium Bromide in Patients With Moderate to Severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) (LAS-MD-35)
clinical_study.official_title: A Long-Term, Randomized, Double-Blind Study of the Safety, Tolerability and Efficacy of Aclidinium Bromide At Two Dosage Levels When Administered to Patients With Moderate to Severe, Stable Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety, tolerability and efficacy of inhaled aclidinium bromide at two dose levels in patients with moderate to severe, stable chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. The study will be 56 weeks in duration; a 2-week rin-in period, a 52-week treatment period and a 2-week follow up phone call. All patients will be randomized to one of two doses of aclidinium bromide.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Morning Pre-dose (Trough) Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1)
primary_outcome.description: Change From Baseline in Morning Predose (Trough) FEV1 in liters at Week 52.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Peak FEV1
secondary_outcome.description: Change From Baseline in Peak FEV1 in liters at Week 52.

arm_group.description: aclidinium bromide, inhaled, 52 weeks of treatment
aclidinium bromide, inhaled, 52 weeks of treatment

intervention.description: aclidinium bromide 200 μg, oral inhalation twice per day for 52 weeks of treatment
aclidinium bromide 400 μg, oral inhalation twice per day for 52 weeks of treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A diagnosis of stable moderate to severe COPD as defined by the Global Initiative for Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease (GOLD) guidelines, 2010; postbronchodilator FEV1/FVC < 70%, and postbronchodilator FEV1 ≥ 30% and < 80% predicted
- Current or former cigarette smokers
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have been hospitalized for an acute COPD exacerbation within 3 months before the first visit
- Respiratory tract infection or COPD exacerbation in the 6 weeks before Visit 1
- Patient with any clinically significant respiratory conditions other than COPD, cardiovascular conditions or mental illness
- History or presence of asthma verified from medical records
- Chronic use of oxygen therapy greater than or equal to 15 hours per day
- Patient with uncontrolled infection due to HIV and/or active hepatitis
- Patients with a history of hypersensitivity reaction to inhaled anticholinergics
- Patients with clinically significant cardiovascular conditions, including myocardial infarction during the previous 6 months, newly diagnosed arrhythmia within the previous 3 months, unstable angina, unstable arrhythmia that had required changes in pharmacological therapy or other intervention.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patient recruitment occurred from November of 2009 to April of 2010 at 109 study sites (106 sites in the United States and 3 additional sites in Canada). A total of 97 study sites randomized patients (94 in the United States and 3 in Canada).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A 2-week run-in period was used to assess the stability of patients’ disease and to establish each patient’s baseline characteristics. The run-in period was followed by a 52-week double-blind treatment period.

group.title: Aclidinium Bromide 200µg
group.description: Aclidinium bromide, 200 microgram dose, oral inhalation twice per day for 52 weeks of treatment.

group.title: Aclidinium Bromide 400µg
group.description: Aclidinium bromide, 400 microgram dose, oral inhalation twice per day for 52 weeks of treatment.

baseline.population: Of 605 patients randomized, 602 patients (99.5%) received at least 1 dose of double-blind treatment and were included in the Safety Population

group.title: Aclidinium Bromide 200µg
group.description: Aclidinium bromide, 200 microgram dose, oral inhalation twice per day for 52 weeks of treatment.

group.description: Aclidinium bromide, 400 microgram dose, oral inhalation twice per day for 52 weeks of treatment.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Morning Pre-dose (Trough) Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1)
outcome.description: Change From Baseline in Morning Predose (Trough) FEV1 in liters at Week 52.
outcome.population: Of 605 patients randomized, 602 patients (99.5%) received at least 1 dose of double-blind treatment and were included in the Safety Population. Of these 602 patients, 600 (99.2%) had a baseline and at least 1 postbaseline FEV1 assessment and qualified for the ITT Population. A decision to terminate one site was made before unblinding of the study.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event reporting occurred from November 2009 to May 2011 at 97 study sites (94 in the United States and 3 in Canada).
reported_events.desc: Of 605 patients randomized, 602 patients (99.5%) received at least 1 dose of double-blind treatment and were included in the Safety Population; 311 patients for aclidinium bromide 200µg and 291 patients for aclidinium bromide 400µg

group.title: Aclidinium Bromide 200µg
group.description: Aclidinium bromide, 200 microgram dose, oral inhalation twice per day for 52 weeks of treatment.

group.title: Aclidinium Bromide 400µg
group.description: Aclidinium bromide, 400 microgram dose, oral inhalation twice per day for 52 weeks of treatment.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: All data generated in this study will be the property of Forest Research Institute, Inc. An integrated clinical and statistical report will be prepared at the completion of the study. Publication of the results by the Investigator will be subject to mutual agreement between the Investigator and Forest Research Institute, Inc.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Site 1420 randomized 31 patients who were discontinued by 21 Jan 2011 due to significant deviations documented in a letter to the FDA on 07 Jan 2011. No changes to the analyses were prospectively specified in the amended statistical analysis plan.
